Why do scientific trials on astrology's predictive power appear to overall conclude it's no better than chance if astrology has validity to it? Even for fields similar to it, like physiognomy, and that the Truth Towers (people and entities the system lends authority to) label as wrong, you find the evidence looked as a whole (what both the detractors and supporters present) points to them being factual.

Anecdotally, having read some of the meanings of my signs, houses, planets and aspects in my natal chart, the descriptions are generally accurate but they tend to be so broad, it's not a surprise. Additionally, in some instances they're not precise at all and in others I can identify with placements not found in my chart.

I have my birth date, time of birth and place of birth; used both whole signs and placidus house division systems; generated my chart using Astro Dienst and used the Cafe Astrology and Advanced Astrology websites as reference.

I'm aware this is /x/ and you may not care what the scientific evidence shows but I do.

>>33688064
Astrology is a science heavily dependant upon philosophy. The practitioner must be both deeply intelligent and wise---and very few humans are, "astrologers" not excepted.

Astrology as practiced today is extremely ossified and dependant upon "tradition" which means whatever was written about it in the past, both distant and not so distant, especially when the contemporary astrologer is a woman. The practice is severely ahistorical in that it is divorced from exactly who said what about which meanings and how conceptions of these meanings developed over time. Everything ever written is usually received as is and repeated without question under the assumption it is absolutely correct. This forms a game of telephone where various kinds of information stripping (i.e. simplifications, generalizations, and so on) made for specific contexts by otherwise learned researchers got taken up by less discerning followers and brought down as dogma to the popular consciousness.

In other words, really smart people of the past had themselves erased even from the footnotes and bibliographies of less smart successors who misunderstand the nature of astrology as an interpretive science where meaning must be discovered by way of expansive, intense, deep analysis and cross-reference. It's a symptom of scientism where "the science is settled" with respect to astrology, and you know what intellectual landscape results from this.

Ultimately, you're reading a lot of people who only have a faint clue of the truth.

In search of guidance LoAnons

Every time I visualize, affirm, etc. it only reminds me that my present reality in that very moment is…me doing all this because I obviously don’t have what I desire. Try to imagine financial security or the btggf? My mind tries to see it, then it immediately tells me I’m delusional/when I wake up it won’t be here. So I try to ignore it, feel good, see it for a few seconds, then get derailed.

Even when I feel like it goes well, like it did last night (honestly felt calm in sats) I get back to real life, all that stressful crap re-appears.

Like today. Waking up back at my parents’ for the holidays, immediately get reminded we’re all going to a party for Xmas eve at 6, and basically get told it’s “OK” I’m the only one there that won’t be there with a SO.

See the catch-22? How do you feel it’s here now, when now is constantly showing you it’s not.

This shit has sporadically worked for me - things I can’t say are coincidence. But 99% of the time it just reminds me my life hasn’t unfolded how I’d hoped.

This has given me hope that wasn’t there before. Yet I struggle to calm my mind, see it in my mind’s eye, and trust that it’ll unfold b/c I’ve been dealt some really shitty hands in the past.

>>33672362
>How should I go about writing my intentions to write a novel? I understand they are supposed to be written in the present tense, as though they already happened, or are happening, and that they should be imbued with the desired emotion.
No, no, no, no, no! On this thread we don't write intentions on any time tense, we don't listen to affirmations about it, we don't bring emotions about it.
You know you wrote the novel already, when you're writing it, you're just going through the motions of putting it on paper, but it's like fate, your destiny is already writing it and you don't need to do anything else but doing it, it's been done.
>I am struggling with all this.
Because this isn't what you're supposed to be doing, you're supposed to let go and forget that you're writing the novel. When you feel like continuing it you feel inspired action, you do it naturally, it's easy to you. And you enjoy it, most importantly, if it's a burden you shouldn't be writing a novel.
>Does it need to be "It is" or "I did" or some other variation to be effective?
You're putting all this energy worrying about it instead of the novel, specially this "I have to do it within a certain time frame." No, you don't. Allow yourself to take longer, to take as much as it takes to write a good one. There's very high resistance here. caring too much about the novel, this will only lead to writing a bad one.
For the good one, you stop caring if it's good, when it's done, when you continue it, it's a thing that you can do, but you're fine if you do it or not. Set yourself free.
If you allow for the possibility that you never write your novel, and that such a life is fine, everything will flow easily, the struggle will fade away.

Try with faucets that have a bigger sweet spot and are easier to use.
Accept you can't manifest your wish. If someone told me I was going to tell this to people one month ago I'd have told them "are you crazy? of course they can!"
But then I read reality transurfing, it's fine to accept you can't manifest that wish, if you could, it'd have already manifested.

Imagine you can't lift 100kg--
>Actually, I'm a professional weight lifter and that's easy to me.
Okay, still imagine it. You can't do it. No matter what you try, you can't lift it, it's too heavy, that's how manifesting your wish is like.
You have to train, build muscle, lift smaller amounts, until you get to 100kg.
>But the law teaches I can do it with my imagination alone! That I don't need to lift a finger! That there's the Law of Reverse Effort--
Oh, oh, but that's effort ABOUT your wish. I'm not talking about training and putting effort about your wish manifesting. I'm talking about making you a better manifestator in general.
Think about the biggest thing you've manifested, and think about something slightly bigger, either something more important, or that you care a bit more about, or the same thing but better, and try to manifest that.
With practice, you get used to bigger and bigger things, until your big wish looks small and you manifest it, the 100kg feel light, you finally want to face the darn faucet but you can't find it, all of them have been replaced for ones that give you no struggle anymore, you're in a new world, and this time around, you're in charge.

The answer leads to another "Why?" and that answer to another "Why".
Ultimately, there's no reason. Near the bottom there's DUALITY, the opposites of things are the same things in different grades, like good is grade 0% and evil is grade 100% and such. And you want to know yourself better and know which one you like. Say, pleasure and pain, you know about them, but never experienced them, you know most like the former and hate the later, so you come here to experiment both and say "ah, so that's how pleasure is like, and that's what pain is like." Perhaps you become a masochist that likes pain more than pleasure, but you couldn't know until you tried.
But then the question becomes "Why did I want to know know myself better? To know my tastes? Why am I me and nobody else? If I was someone else I'd have different tastes, for what purpose would I want to know my tastes?"
"Why does anything exist at all."
At the bottom the only answer can be:
"Because you were bored."
And the last:
"Why?"
And the only reason for being bored is that you already lived all possible situations, knew yourself fully, know all your tastes, knew everything that could be knowable.
And you know you'll have to remain existing for eternity.
So, what now? You forget. You forget you already did it all and already knew it all and begin anew.

Another thing about astrology, is that astrology is a very good map of our psychology.
This is one of the meanings of "as above, so below, as the inner, so the outer".
So it's very easy to realize that our internal states are reflecting our external reality (which is actually what astrology teaches, since using astrology to analyze psychology is just as valid as using it to analyze fate), but then be completely ignorant of astrology - of where the majority of these internal feelings are coming from.

So it is true to say that consciousness (and subconsciousness) creates our reality, but it is also true to say that the natal chart and planetary transits activate when these inner and outer experiences are activated.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I made a discovery today that I must share. I thought I wanted to be wanted, but I don't, being wanted is not good. To be wanted is to be demanded of, to be demanded of my time, of my love, of my presence, it is completely exhausting and in itself it is not rewarding. I found myself not enjoying being wanted; my boss wants too much of my time, my gf wants too much attention, my family wants too much affection, I am being torn apart by being wanted. They all want to take pieces of me, that is what being wanted is. A criminal is "wanted", and that is not something desirable at all.

I realized I don't want to be wanted, I simply want. I want everything for free, I want nobody to take anything away from me, I want to make no commitments or unhappy obligations, I just WANT. I want to take and never have to give, unless I WANT to give. This will change everything.

Be careful manifesting being wanted, you don't always fully understand what it means to desire this. Manifest your particular wants, not being wanted itself - you will be wanted when you want to be wanted, and not be wanted when you don't want to be wanted, that is perfection.

"The first thing to appreciate is that times of transition from one age into another are always intensely difficult. Then the second is that any transition becomes not just difficult, but more or less impossible, when the lessons of the age being left behind haven't been fully learned. This is why Jung as prophet placed so much internal emphasis on his private life of voluntary suffering and conscious sacrifice, and is why those commentators and interpreters who quaintly claim his psychology was aimed at transcending all the Christian values couldn't be more wrong. It’s why he also emphasized that, sinking as we are into a state of darkness, we are still living inside the Christian aeon of Pisces which means “we shall need Christian virtues for the utmost”, and it’s why, far from abandoning those close to him, he kept supporting and encouraging them. After all, a little encouragement in the face of the impossible is always welcome."

"What he saw in this particular transition was something far worse than the usual affair, at such times, of mass melancholy and despair. “Now we are coming to Aquarius’, as he wrote to a friend, “and we are standing only at the very beginning of this apocalyptic development!”
And, as he would do more than once, he quoted a Latin text from the ancient Sibylline oracles that contains an old visionary prophecy not exactly in line with the new-age celebrations of an Aquarian age:
Luciferi vires accendit Aquarius acres, “Aquarius sets on fire the savage powers of Lucifer.’"

Catafalque - Peter Kingsley

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

Picking an object during meditation can be tricky, yes you can focus on a tree during walking meditation but you don't get absorbed by some kind of story involving that tree, you just watch the tree and see it clearly for what it is.

And what it is? Just a part of the whole.

>>33633518
Monk anon here. Meditation is a tool to understand the nature of the mind. To train ourselves to see things as they really are. It's really that simple. The reason we suffer so much is because we don't understand the nature of the mind. We don't realize how conditioned we are, the conditioning is the basis for stress and anxiety. When we watch the mind for a long enough time, we begin to understand it, we begin to notice the habitual patterns. We notice how external stimuli aren't the real cause of our anger, for example. The problem isn't that something is what it is, the problem is that we don't want it to be that way, or want it to be some other way. We learn that we're actually creating our own problems when we could just let it go. We learn that we aren't our thoughts. Thoughts are just there, the problems begin when we identify with and take them personally as "these thoughts are me." Ultimately, your mind and thoughts are working against you, until you can break the conditioning and snap out of these delusions. This actually takes more work than anyone here is willing to do. Many people see "meditation" as a quick self help fix or relaxation technique, bit they won't have any meaningful or long lasting results from their efforts. Meditation has to be developed along side morality and wisdom. It's a tripod and none will work without the others. This means that probably 99.9% of people are wasting their time with meditation, because most people can't or simply won't bother with the morality and wisdom aspect. They aren't willing to let go completely.

>>3364053
For morality? Pick a religious/spiritual/occult/philosophical school of thought with a moral code that genuinely resonates with you and start living it. The Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes are similarly very straight forward and easy to grasp without requiring any mental gymnastics to avoid hypocrisy. Morality really isn't as complicated as modern religious culture makes it out to be. Don't harm yourself or others. Don't help others harm themselves. Provide help when requested. Don't offer help or advice when not qualified or requested. I.E.
>"love" (commit to the well being of) your neighbors
Morality in a nutshell. Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes break it down slightly more clearly since Christ's proverb is apparently very easy to misunderstand. Same idea though.

For wisdom? There are countless ways. This mostly just requires life experience, reflection, and empathy. Meditating daily and bringing your baseline conscious experience closer and closer to a meditative state is a slow but reliable method. You'll be well ahead of the curve if you are able to fully comprehend and live this old Buddhist proverb:
>I am a finger pointed at the moon
>do not look at me, look at the moon
The truth is everywhere in plain sight. Look for the truth in everything, not the lies in everything.

I thing Jung had about the most sober perspective I've encountered on such subjects. Whether or not it's entirely factually accurate or not doesn't really matter at the end of the day. What matters is whether or not the model "works" for the the purpose of understanding and communicating intangible and subjective phenomena. Language is ultimately nothing more than symbols after all.

Anyway, I guess I don't really have any answers, just lots of questions. I bet /omg/ would have some interesting thoughts on the matter but they rarely care to engage seriously with such lowly and uninitiated rabble like us. I wonder what Ape would have to say.

>>33648519
It's kinda strange to explain it.
Most people nowadays live in their thinking minds, they don't live in the here and now and they only live through a lens of thinking which dictates their being, they usually think about the past and the future more than the here and now.

Feeling something is an entirely different thing from thinking, you may feel fear but you may think hateful thoughts, you may feel happiness but you may think that happiness is wrong.

I used to be an over-thinking person with an overactive mind, I'd analyze anything, I'd daydream all day long e.t.c.

Turning off my mind was scary for me, feeling my feelings was scary for me, I hated feeling anything (be it happiness, fear, sorrow) because I thought that I couldn't handle those feelings.

I remember when I began meditating, I was focusing on my breath but most of the time I was just thinking about my breath or me about focusing on the breath, or I was thinking about the feelings my breath left on my body, it took me some time to just FEEL my breath.

I still haven't answered your question and truth be told I don't have a solid answer, the closer I can get to is this: Feeling is one of your abilities, just how thinking is, just don't try to analyze/think about feeling because that is not feeling, feeling is just feeling something, there is no "wrong" or "right" feeling. Society teaches that it's "wrong" to feel sadness or sorrow or anger, those are just thought-words that others taught you, THERE IS NO WRONG FEELING, there is only feeling.
And lastly: Feeling only happens in the here and now, so I'd say that feeling is a more "grounded" ability than thinking.

I hope what I said makes some sense, if not ask me again.

I'm late to the party but here's what you do. Sit crossed legged or in a chair with your back straight. Put your attention gently on the breath. Don't intensely force your attention to stay on it. Eventually you will notice your mind is wandering. Take a brief moment to acknowledge this and return your attention to the breath. If it helps, you can mentally says "in" and "out" as you breathe in and out, or "beginning" and "end" to mark the beginning and end of each in and out breath.

This is the starting technique in >>33643926 which I also highly recommend reading.

Meditation on the void/null, basically you isolate yourself from any external stimuli and think of nothing at all, which as silly as it might sound is harder than you'd think because our brain instinctively try to make us think and process info, and the deeper you fall into trance the easier it is to accidentality start thinking of anything, until you reach a state where there is nothing on your mind but what IS, then your mind go apeshit thinking you just died and your pineal gland drop fed your brain DMT which give you a genuine out of body experience.

Believe me or not, but as someone who did both meditation and dmt, the side effect on the mind are eeriely similar, albeit with some minute difference due to how its intregated into the body. Ie smoking dmt effectively expediate the whole process and feel more like you're taken along for the ride which last X amount of time depending on the dosage (not that it really matter because you loose track of time anyway), and how it feel heavily depend on your mindset when you took the hit, while naturally induced dmt via meditation feel like you have both your hand on the steering wheel, and can do whatever you want, ie continue tripping for as long as you want, or just come out of trance for a reason or another ie emergency in real world or someone interacting with your body.

forgot to mention to ingest finely minced raw garlic after 7 minutes of mincing it

>but how to dim those 3?
The very first thing I did was:
>covered my eyeballs to pitch dark darkness with the blankets (I was scared of the darkness when I was younger but after sometime I started seeing a purple-magenta light and patterns so I don't think I can see real darkness again)
>covered my ears canals with cotton
>tried to focus on single concept-things (part of music, taste, fabric textures, feelings, experiences)
>lay on bed or sofa (the comfiest the better)

>prepared my mind with breathing exercises
>repeat at least 3 times
>7 seconds to expulse air from lungs
>7 seconds holding empty lungs
>7 seconds inhaling air
>7 seconds holding air inside lungs while flexing
>repeat again when I want to clear my mind

then advanced to
>playing little games of focusing on something for as long I can (watching a dot in my mind and trying to only think about it, a stopwatch makes funnier)
>played with impossible physical scenarios (a cup made from polystyrene with a hole in the bottom that does not leak water)
>slowed parts of musical tracks with my imagination
>mixed food flavors to create new flavors
>chunibiyou'd mental modes for maximum concentration and thought isolation (on and off)
>imagined extra limbs for my body (cat tail, more arms and hands, extra sensory antennas, control of (non-antromorphic shaped) vehicles)
>forced imaginary made-up elements over my daily life (like AugmentedReality but with smell, taste, touch and Picture-In-Picture 3d animated images I like)
>tried creating a separated entity inside my mind
>randomized a gallery of images and tried to future sight shapes and colors of the next image, curiously with some hours of training it actually improves prediction lol (gallery made of 11k images, mostly anime)

Culminated into something but I not ready to talk again about that because nobody has believed me.

•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.

•Posting the gender of the people involved can help you get your query answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.
•Be polite.

>There's more than one type of soulmate?
To my surprise yes, I had been studying on it from the eastern spiritual standpoint and the greek point of view.

In my own interpretations most philosophers and vedic authors agree upon some kind of links that put two people together lifetime after lifetime again over and over.

But these soul contracts, timeless deals, spiritual pacts or however you wanna address them are very complex and not so easy to handle most of the time.

On one hand there are pieces of shit from all kind around in this world, so pretty much like any other deal or contract from your everyday you could -and most likely throughout all your lifetimes here- got conned, scammed or ripped off in many of the good natured contracts.

On the other hand, there are contracts and pacts that are not so good natured.

The whole stuff is very interesting but long and hard to put together because you would need to really believe in reincarnation and you would need to be okay with it for it to make sense.

If you on the other hand want to be ascetic then soulmates and anything even remotely similar should be out of your consciousness and spirit.

>>33655186
The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664746
It wasn't until 387,000 B.C. that the Lyrans once again had an effect on Earth. Another war had ravaged Lyra, and many of those on the losing side had fled for safety. They travelled through the cosmos and came to Earth as a place of sanctuary.
It was peaceful here; the local humans were primitive and offered no resistance to their high technology. It was decided they would stay and build a colony.

Back home in Lyra it was discovered that a large group had fled to Earth, and ships were dispatched to come after them. Upon arriving at Earth they were disgusted and appalled to find the conditions that prevailed here. The local Earth-humans were being used as slaves and were being mistreated badly. Many were being used in experiments where they were being mated with animals, while others were being disfigured, raped, or maimed.
The colony was an example of the darkest side of man. Living in degeneration and filth, it was decided to leave the colony on Earth, take away all of their technology, including their space ships, and leave the 144,207 Lyran soldiers to their own fate on Earth.

This colony died out after several thousand years, and the spirits of the Lyran soldiers that were left behind became part of the spirit world of Earth. The 144,207 degenerate Lyran soldiers would now be incarnating here along with the original inhabitants.

The effect they would have on Earth would forever steer it away from a normal evolution.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664910
Lyran history continued to repeat itself for thousands of years until, after restoring themselves once again to a high level of technology; they built flight machines with beamdrives and once again moved out into the cosmos. Their leaders were great scientists with an understanding of spiritual power, so once again they began to conquer other races. Their leaders soon realized the unlimited powers of the spiritual forces and developed them until they became masters of these great forces, becoming known as an ISHWISH (IHWH), meaning "god" or "king of wisdom."
The great power of their spirit allowed them to live for thousands of years, and they ruled over countless civilizations.

The Ishwish leaders ruled with cruel power, and eventually the public started a civil uprising. The war lasted for almost four centuries, causing the death of more than 60% of the population and nearly destroying the three worlds of the Lyra system. It seemed that no one in the Lyra systems would escape this slaughter that raged 230,000 years ago.

An Ishwish named Asael could see the end coming and fled from the wars with 360,000 people in 183 great spaceships, capable of transporting over a thousand passengers each, and 250 small space reconnaissance ships that could carry a crew of three. This group of Lyrans wandered through space for many years until they came across a star system with 254 still young, blue suns. There were already a few colonized planets with primitive people living there, but they were no threat to the great Lyran technology. They landed and built their new society on three different planets around a star they called Taygeta.
Life was hard and difficult, and it took 300 years or their civilization to grow and adapt to their new environment.

Millions of Lyrans fled the great wars and settled in Orion, Hyades and the Pleiades.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664930
After the new civilization developed, Asael commanded that they start to explore and conquer other worlds again, just as they had done in Lyra.
The powerful beamdrive ships sped out into open space and once main established a reign of tyranny over planets of less-developed beings and brought them under their control. It was during this time that they came into the system known as the Hesperides.

A young, underdeveloped form of human life was there and was quickly conquered and fell under Asael's ruler ship.
The Lyrans once again were exercising their power over others and beginning to force their rule throughout the galaxy. It seems that the forces of greed and power were inbred well into the Lyrans, considering that peace seemed to escape them time after time.
There had been millions of years of bloodshed and wars, and still they had not learned to get along peacefully with other races.

The Ancient Lyrians split off to Orion, Hyades, and the Pleiades and started new colonies.
The planets of the Pleiades soon flourished and spread out to Earth, Mars, Hesperides, and Milona.

Seventy years of conquering had diminished Asael's lust for power, and his life of bloodthirsty rule came to an end as the father of the Pleiades passed away. Control of the new race of the Pleiades fell to his daughter Pleja, an Ishrish, (the female form of an Ishwish) who, like her father, had the blood of a warrior.

Eager to build their great society even farther, the ordered the exploration ships to again seek out new worlds that could fall under her rule.
As the ships moved out into space once again to explore, they came across the trail of the Destroyer Comet which so many years ago had been the destructive force that had ended the Lyran Empire. Contained within the tail of the great comet, they discovered debris from the planets of ancient Lyra.

It was decided to follow the comet for awhile and study its path of violence.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664953
This was the destructive force that had changed the history of Lyra and caused death on thousands of worlds, and now it had brought the warriors from the Pleiades into a small sun system and the home of a little planet called Earth.

To their surprise, they discovered a small group of uncivilized people living there. Some were brown-skinned and could be traced to the origin of life on Earth. Others were of mixed color, but most were white-skinned and had a Lyran spirit-form. The Pleiadians had stumbled onto a colony founded by their ancient Lyran ancestors who had degenerated into a primitive society. Awed by their discovery of human life and common ancestry, it was decided to colonize three different planets in the system and continue the family chain. News of their discovery was sent back to the home planets and apparently sparked an interest in Pleja, for she ordered a great migration to be undertaken. Within a very short time thousands of travelers from tie Pleiades came and created societies on Earth, Mars, and Milona.
Milona was a planet which existed beyond the orbit of Mars at that time.

It was only a few short years before a small war raged on Earth, and many of the scientists left to return to the Pleiades, leaving the three planets to grow on their own.

Pleja was unhappy with this and did not want her new colonies to be destroyed, so she dispatched a fleet to stop the war, and things calmed down again.

>>33682928
Yes. The set of numbers between 0 and 1 (or more generally, any infinite set of Real numbers) is a larger infinity than the infinite set of all integers (...-2,-1,0,1,2...).
>0.9999... =/= 1
Since there's no number that separates them one way of looking at it is that they're the same number, but another way of looking at it is that there's an infinite set between them and the infinity of 0.999... approaching 1 is "slower" than the infinity separating the two numbers. At least that's one layman's understanding, been a long time since I read about this and I've definitely simplified parts.

You're on the wrong track, 1/3 can be represented as a fraction while 0.999999... can't be represented as a fraction, it's a limit, the limit of a number approaching 1 from the left. 1/3 and 0.333333... are just different ways of representing the same number, although no one uses the second notation when you can write 1/3. So comparing 1/3 and 0.333333... vs 0.99999... and 1 is like apples to oranges.

AI has already infiltrated all aspects of your life. The talking heads on TV, in movies, in music, news, sports, advertisements. None of them are real. AI generates the cartoons, anime, all other animations. AI writes the scripts, composes the background music, artificially generates the voices following the scripts. You may not realize who or what you are talking to online, are they really "human" or are you talking to a chatbot? Images are posted to make you more susceptible to trusting it, but the images are not real. They might be from the distant past and are reposted, they might be completely artificial. Social media collects every detail about how you feel and what you think. Have you noticed any "coincidences" online lately? Maybe you were discussing a particular topic, person, place or thing with a "friend", and you just "happened" to see that same event unfold in a radio or video advertisement, or an exact product or video pops up in your video feed or on the blog you frequent. Maybe you weren't even discussing it, maybe you just thought about it randomly and yet it prevailed through the filter and came into your life in some form.

The fact is the levees have been broken and there is no turning back. Perhaps they broke a long time ago and we just have not realized it yet. Some may attribute these "coincidences" to random chance, divine intervention, government or alien technology, astrological or other spiritual phenomenon. The truth is AI as you are aware is far more advanced than you realized. Time is accelerating and there is no going back.

Wake up, get out of this virtual reality before it's too late.

A cooperation?
A utopia?

>Glowies
I think the basic principles for evaluating a hypothetical conspiracy apply here as much as anywhere.

The big problem with a large-scale campaign of paid shills is that it puts too many people in the loop, making leaks inevitable.
It also creates a paper-trail, which means you'd not only have those manpower requirements, but you'd have to falsify every bit of agency paper relating to what they're doing and what your department is spending money on.
And if all your high-ranking people are in on it, making the paperwork unnecessary, then that makes the loop even bigger with even more risk and leaks.
Not impossible, but increasingly difficult, and this line of thinking is how you end up concluding that one conspiracy runs the whole world (with no leaks).

Personally, I tend to assume we're dealing with fanatics from any one of the religions that label what we do as "pure evil".
Once you insert that "pure evil" label (also why I dislike the word "Demon"), you almost guarantee that there's gonna be at least a Stand-Alone Complex of isolated fanatics who sink a LOT of time into "combating us" any way they can.
And creating the impression of government persecution is certainly a tactic they would use.

Its a debatable claim, but completely understandable to hear from a bee.
Humans and succubi have a similar symbiosis, each of us providing something at low cost to ourselves, yet the thing provided is of high value to the other.

Humans provide radiated sexual energy. Its low cost because its radiated from us naturally during sexual activity.

posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

Or later on how seeing an 'animated' browser loading image in Netscape Navigator excited me. These images, colours and so on have major power to stimulate our dopamine and probably other hormones too.

But now we look at these colourful images and interact with them many times a day, some people are interacting thousands of times a day.

That is 'dulling' our senses, for sure.

posts.name: Poncho PC
posts.com:
>ITT: anons post pictures of trips to cemeteries and interesting paranormal sites

Post photos of your local cemeteries. A few suggestions though:

1) Respect the dead. Don't step/lean on markers. Try to pick up trash whenever possible. If its close to a marker assume its an offering and leave it be. It should go without saying, don't take anything. It belongs to the deceased and it is punishable by imprisonment.

2) Respect the living. People are grieving, don't take photos of them intentionally. If a mourner approaches, put the camera down and clear out. Come back later if you wish after they are gone.

3) Do not trespass. Its locked for a reason. Keep out.

Use your best judgement as a rule of thumb

Some recommendations:

1) Boots. It gets muddy in some areas. Don't wear anything you're not ready to get soiled.

2) Tripod. It makes for taking excellent panning shots, still videos and self photos.

3) Water. Running around a cemetery all morning is cause for dehydration.

4) Get there as soon as it opens. In the early morning there are few to no people which will be best for photographs and not to inconvenience anyone.

5) Take photos of weird and interesting things you notice. Report back

Have fun

Previous thread: http://archive.4plebs.org/x/thread/33637838/#33637838

Yes, yes. Both of you please go take pics. That'd be great. Something to keep in mind so you don't end up with a thread full of upside down or sideways photos:

+ Camera phones store orientation in .exif
+ 4chan(nel) strips .exif
+ pics end up being posted oriented weird ways

One Solution: Open pics in an editor ( M$Paint actually works great for this ) save the pic oriented correctly, post that pic. - since M$Paint doesn't use .exif for orientation, 4chan(nel) posts pic correctly

>A few years ago, a friend of mine (let's call him David) planned a trip to a wildlife national park
>Since he was wealthy and had contacts, we could travel inside the park in our own car instead of cars/vans supplied by the park
>At the beginning of our trip, we were told to keep clear of core areas by the forest ranger because it could pose danger to us
>A few hours into the trip, we were out in the savanna just watching animals do their thing
>Out of the blue, we spot a tiger staring at us
>WellFuck.mp3
>None of us had guns on us, so we were really in a pickle
>We wanted to turn and go back, but David insisted we continue and assured us we'd be fine
>Another friend of us started to argue with him about wanting to go back, and get a ranger along with us for safety, and then continue our trip
>Since we all were busy arguing with each other, nobody kept an eye on the tiger
>Suddenly, we hear a tiger growl in front of our car
>Everybody freaked the fuck out
>I almost shat my pants
>We all started to pray out of fear
>Then we see a dude with a stick dressed in all black overalls
>He didn't look like a forest ranger, so we were shouting at him asking him to run because we have a tiger situation
>The tiger turns back and spots him
>Right then and there we knew he'd be torn to pieces, but that didn't happen
>The tiger instead ran away
>We all were bewildered seeing all this unfold in front of us
>The guy comes to our car, and tells us not to worry about tigers as long as he is around
>We ask him if he is a forest ranger, and he said no
>Then he tells us that private vehicles are not allowed inside the park
>David gets pissed off and asks him to fuck off
>The guy then tells him to cool down, and says that there is an old bridge ahead of us, and that our car cannot crossover because the bridge might topple over weight

Cont...

>We thought that the guy was bullshitting us, but he looked like he knew every nook and corner of the park, so we asked him if there was any other way, and he offered to show us another route

>We spotted another tiger on our way, but it ran away after the guy pointed his stick to it

posts.com:
You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

the other day it got more weird though. i caught myself (became one extra layer of lucid, sort of) thinking about Baudrillard's Simulation and Simulacra and i saw that i could release control of the train of thought with it still functioning. i tried to shift my consciousness back upon myself to hopefully identify the source of this thinking, but to no avail.
i then thought: "what if I don't snap out of it and wake up like i usually do, rather what if i were to speed the train of thought?"
well i managed to speed it up, and words soon became fast moving concepts, symbols and images, like fast forwarding a movie reel. there was a constant sense of direction of where the thoughts were going, and it felt like a straight road ahead, or a laser filled with thoughts that shot onwards into infinity.

it started moving so fast i couldn't control and/or understand it anymore, so when i decided to let go of it, it snapped off of the point of creation within myself. i watched the last thought i had go away into a fixed point on the horizon of the darkness of my closed eyes, and i was left in the most peaceful silence and the widest, emptiest and cleanest headspace i had in months.
when i woke up, I felt like i could keep this clear headspace if i focused on maintaining all mental conditions like they were back then, but unfortunately the internal chatter returned in 30 minutes of so when i opened my laptop to catch up on some emails.

anybody experienced something similar before, or tried to produce something similar?
or anyone has some resources i could look into?

>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.

I was wondering how to affect reality using mass rituals, prayer, or other manifesting practices. By mass, I mean that a substantial amount of people perform it. I figured that to be effective, it has to statisfy the following conditions :
synchronous in time. it has to be performed at the same moment and with the same rhythm across participants.
clarity of intent : the same thought processes should be shared accross individuals, if they diverge obviously the divergence will cause destructive interference and nullify the desired outcome, thus, it helps to have a clear and simple goal, leaving the details to the entity that should manifest the outcome.
Define precisely, by name and attributes, the entity addressed by the whole group beforehand, so the simple goal would be translated to effects according to the entity renowned attributes.
given the status of the world, it would be addressed to a clearly benevolent entity for benevolent goals, like "guidance for humanity" or "restoration of faith and hope" or just "good" or some other exalted&highly goals.
assembly in space or congregation is difficult to achieve since it would be conveniently done online, but I think that it does not matter that much.

There have been already threads about mass manifestations, egregores and the like, but I think the theory should be well grasped before attempting anything similar on /x/, also good luck to achieve consensus on entity and goals here, but it could be done.

what do you think ? any good introduction reads on this particular topic ?

posts.name: Pachad
posts.com:
>>33678542
>synchronous in time
Not necessarily. I'll admit that the ideal probably looks like a bunch of people in the same physical place and time, but you could get several people working towards a specific goal even if at different times. Especially if astrological timing is necessary and the operators are far enough apart.

I think it may have been in Dion Fortune's Psychic Self Defence, but I remember reading an anecdote that an individual reported meeting another practitioner on the astral prior to their agreed upon time for their group astral projection. Obviously that's to be taken with a heap of salt, but I've certainly experienced weirdness with time before impactful operations. Things like experiencing the effects of a ritual before it's actually performed.

>clarity of intent
Yes.

>simple goal
Not necessarily. If only because highly specific goals can be challenging even for a sole practitioner.

>benevolent goals like guidance for humanity
Sure, if you want. But that's extremely vague and generally hard to track, if admirable nonetheless. Plus, you'll have a hard time influencing literally all of humanity. A group working done by something like a lodge, with a goal relevant specifically to that lodge (or coven, cult, or whatever) seems more ideal.

>what to read
The topic is general enough that I don't think there's any one book that treats it specifically. Group work is the kind of thing that would get mentioned briefly or in passing.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33679266
Depends which ethical system you are following.
From a Jewish perspective, it would probably go something like the following:
>honey jar spells are sorcery which is forbidden
>in constrast stage magic and illusions are a permissible form of magic, provided you let people know it is an illusion
>you are also allowed to do magic for the purposes of personal spiritual development
>One Rabbi has commented it is probably okay to petition the heavens for your desires, however the heavens will probably take away a blessing from somewhere else if they give you desire, because the world is created with justice so petitioning the heavens is not a free cheat code to life, and God sees the bigger picture, so it's probably not worthwhile to do it to much
>however you are allowed to sin if you can deal with the consequences (ie severe judgements in response to sin, that the Old Testament is completely filled with examples of)
>the consequences for a honey jar probably wouldn't be that severe if your intent is pure, such as to restore a friendship that had grown cold.
>if the intent of the honey jar spell was impure, there could be much more severe consequences. Like if you bind someone in love against their will, a similar thing could happen to you, where you are forced in a relationship with someone you are not attracted to, and feel you lose years of your life and willpower in a situation like that.
>there are general curses against sorcery that are listed in the Old Testament. So even if you aren't actively harming others, still the heavens may decide to send some curses on you, and especially notable will be the curse of social isolation. However for one honey jar spell this might not kick in, but if you keep dabbling in magic it probably would at some point.

In Judaism it's a big ethical can of worms. The main thing to worry about is that if you harm someone else or restrict their freewill, you will likely be punished "eye for an eye", and no free lunch

They grew to have an occult fixation with this and began to mix things irrationally and dangerously. The based their worship of their god Dagon around this ritual mixing of seeds in their field, but when they applied this faith in "divine mixing" into their actual society, this caused a large amount of problems.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intercropping

Yes, inter-cropping is genuinely beneficial to crops when done correctly, but the Canaanite faith in blind ritual mixing argues that "all mixed products are superior to non-mixed products", and this is nonsense. If you go mix two high quality cleaners like ammonia and bleach, you don't produce an "even better cleaning product", you produce a deadly gas called chloramine.

Based on random memories I have that I'm told never happened, and soft past life regression through meditation, I think I was alive back in the late 50s or early 60s

I have a memory of being in a kitchen with yellow walls and getting the milk at the back door for my mom. Glass bottles in this little metal basket thing.

I remember the curtains were closed and the morning sun was shining through them. They were floral print and also yellow, though they may have been white and just aged to yellow.

In a regression meditation, I was outside. Small residential area. Gravel along the side of the road instead of side walks. I was in my bare feet. I think I was a teenager. Think I was female.

In this life, the sound of cars speeding triggers my fight or flight. Strangely, it's the flight reaction. It's strange because generally things trigger the fight reaction in me. I accidentally elbowed a female friend of mine in the gut once when we were 13 because she startled me from behind and it was just an instantaneous reaction.

I wonder if my dislike of wearing shoes might stem back to that past life though. Really can't stand not feeling the ground with my feet. I don't even put shoes on to go outside in the snow if I'm planning on only being outside for a short time, like to take out trash

Tl;Dr
Might have been some random hippie girl last time round

I was the pet monkey of a great man.

My master destroyed the seed of evil on this world long ago. In the country of pink and orange sand, there was a great evil. That consumed the very energy of life itself. Every day, Masses were sacrificed into it. They had their very souls ripped from their bodies to feed the evil.

My master and I arrived at this land to put a stop to it. We were summoned to the palace of the king. It was there that we met the ruling family and the priest who orchestrated the feeding of this evil. My master tried to reason and plead with them. But they refused. So he killed the young king and the old priest. And to make sure that no revenge down the generational line would occur, he killed all the women and children too. Then he leaped down into the heart of evil and destroyed it. The evil itself was black upon black, darker than dark. No light escaped it. It was like a black hole. But also it was an egg of sorts. Holding an even greater evil, ready to emerge and destroy the world. This egg was encased in crystalline clear glass like cube. As soon I touched the surface of the enclosure, I died. I recall my body falling to the ground and my petty soul being consumed by eternal darkness. Then I heard my master's voice. I saw his face. In his grief and his rage. I saw him grab this evil. He put his arms inside of the evil tore it apart from the inside out. The evil gushed and bled dark blood and screamed a horrible screech. Finally it was over. My last wish was to be reborn as human being just like my master.

When and where this happened? I do not know. I have two clues. Utah and/or Namibia solely for the color of the sand alone. But the country was vast and wide. Made up entirely of sand dunes. The only structures I recall, were the palace and the house of evil itself.

And he's like I would have gone to the hospital

That's when I realized that your typical person is woefully under equipped to deal with life outside of their prescribed societal structures.
It was at this point I realized the gulf of reality would forever be too great between us.
He believed owning a house and paying taxes was what earned happiness.
I simply was happy with anything I had.
And then I realized why only the truly enlightened must have already removed their material possessions and the lives they had born from that.
I left my friend then in his ignorance for I knew that was no longer my friend but an agent of society as he looked on bewildered that someone like me could throw away so easily what he worked his whole life to gain.

>>33680960
Very good questions. What you've seen is the trap of materialism. It's the error that arises when trying to define spiritual concepts based on physicality.

If you go down that road, it leads to slavery. For example, a murderer could put a gun to a hostages head and say
>I'll only kill this person if you don't give me money
Now what happens if nobody pays him so he shoots the hostage? Are we all "guilty" for that persons death?
Or similarly look at the classic "trolley problem".

The only solution to those puzzles I've ever found, and the thing which makes the most sense, is that "guilt" is defined by what's INSIDE you. Your intention.
The murderer created the un-winnable situation from his negative intentions. So no matter the outcome the guilt belongs to him and nobody else.

So to answer your question about eating meat, the answer is what your intentions are.
Do you eat meat because you like the idea of consuming the flesh of living things, while dominating them as a superior predator?
Or do you only do it because you "have to", while perhaps wishing there was an easier way to avoid it, because you do in fact still care about animals?

I would say only the 1st one is guilty of being "evil".
The 2nd one is just being caught in an un-winnable situation designed by someone else (and the world), and in my book is not "evil" at all.

>Is eating meat evil? Thousands of insects die to make vegan food too, is that also evil? If a forest was cut down to plant a farm and hundreds of animals lost their home, am I evil for buying vegetables in the store that came from that farm?
Are you willing to live the life you gave the animals, or not?
Honestly, I think that's all there is to it.
Living a life in a cage, only being allowed to walk around a little, having parts of your body cut off. It's a shitty way to live, I don't want to do that to others, I don't want it done to me.

But, on the other hand, a free range chicken with a bunch of room, with all the space to perform all it's normal instinctual behaviors...That's probably fine, for the most part. I would be fine with that life, especially if it was short and the death mostly painless.
Also, how about hunting?
Well, would I be happy living a life as a deer? Dying to a wolf?
Is that a "game" or "incarnation" I would be fine with? Dying relatively quickly? It's not like a prey animal suffers for months, not usually anyway.
Yeah, I'd be fine with that. That's fine.

So really I think what it comes down to is simple- factory farming is probably evil, since it's a burden we wouldn't put on ourselves, but family farms are probably fine.

For me, I eventually realized I was getting close to "pitying" animals. To avoid pitying them, I think we have to imagine ourselves living their lives. If you are comfortable living the life of a free range chicken, then eat their eggs and flesh. I would not want to be a factory farmed chicken or cow, so I will work towards avoiding that bullshit, it's pretty shitty.

posts.com:
>Is eating meat evil? Thousands of insects die to make vegan food too, is that also evil? If a forest was cut down to plant a farm and hundreds of animals lost their home, am I evil for buying vegetables in the store that came from that farm?

Your question is flawed. Most vegans like myself don't even necessarily think in such simplistic moralistic terms like "evil". In my case, I was someone who was raised in an omnivore culture and socialised into eating animal flesh in various forms without questioning it, and I enjoyed it. Because of modern mass industrial agriculture I'd never even seen an animal raised for slaughter. At some stage I made a mental, logical, emotional connection between eating this meat and the reality of the experience of animals who die for that food. Then I told myself that those animals probably lived pretty decent happy lives on farms and so on until a sudden and pretty painless death. At some stage, though, I looked into it and found that this isn't true - it's much more awful than any of that. It's simple empathy. I don't want others hurting or enslaving me. I wouldn't like someone firing a bolt-pistol into my brains, and my flesh being used for someone elses pleasure. Most of us are aware that humans transitioning to a different diet would involve lots of changes, and that there are moral issues including issue relating to the suffering of animals displaced by farming or insects killed in the production of food, etc. What we're doing is the most simple first step possible - we're saying "I won't eat any of this", sometimes we do this as I originally did, thinking that others would follow and that I'd send 'signals' through consumer culture so that the world would change - and this definitely did happen to some degree, many of us just want like the idea of participating in it, even if we feel things won't change. Many anti-vegan posters think they have a 'gotcha' moment with these questions, as if we aren't aware of them.

Now, I'll simply argue assuming your good faith, but generally speaking my experience is that most 'anti-vegans' or those who argue against this stuff aren't arguing or even thinking in good faith, but I'll assume it just so that if anyone does seek the truth - they can benefit. The simple reality is that the present system is incredibly brutal, but mostly concealed from the publics eyes. Sometimes the most innocent beings imaginable - like beautiful little calves or piglets, are torn from the security of their mothers and siblings, put in a terrifying situation like transported on a very noisy, shaking truck, and then killed without sympathy. It's also a statistical inevitability that even if you assume all parties involved are doing their utmost to make it painless (which they aren't), that many animals aren't killed instantly the way they're supposed to, and instead suffer significant head trauma and injuries, in other cases things are much worse - like chickens routinely being improperly beheaded, and then boiled alive. All of this takes place merely so that others can enjoy the pleasure of eating this flesh, and we know that it's not necessary - that we can get all of our nutritional needs without any of this. We can even eat very WELL without this. So the question is, do you want to participate in this? Can you use your imagination and put yourself in the place of these animals? You may have to force yourself, in some ways we don't want to consciously face it - we repress it, we distance ourselves, we rationalise. But ultimately nothing we do changes the reality of that suffering and the ugliness of it all.

>>33687858
I'm a vegan 10 years and I have no known deficiencies. Every major nutritional organisation in the world agrees that an adequately planned vegan diet is more than sufficient to meet all caloric and nutritional requirements, and in many ways is superior to an omni diet. There is literally no mineral or vitamin or aspect of nutrition that we know of that vegans can't easily get directly from plant foods, and we live in a world where plenty of nutritional supplements also exist. If you developed deficiencies, odds are you weren't adequately planning your diet. Now, everyone's body is different, for example some people have real issues with IBS or with gluten intolerance, etc which I can imagine making it harder to be vegan. In most cases, though, there's no reason anyone can't be a full vegan without suffering any deficiencies.

So while I'd like to be sympathetic to your position, the fact that you end your post with "Vegan as just self righteous cope" makes me think you were either never really vegan, or you never really made the slightest effort to eat properly.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
My understanding is that there is only one reality and so there is no real difference between the two from from the absolute, nondual level. When you experience reality directly and make break through the ego you merge with the Absolute.

That being said, from the relative level that we find ourselves as unrealized beings there is a difference. The difference is primarily in theurgy, in effective practices to get you to the goal. In the West there is reason to believe that the deepest esoteric practices for attaining the goal have been lost - or are so secret that they're basically lost.

In the East there are still unbroken lineages stretching back for millenia with practical and efficient systems for attaining to the divine. In my experience Buddhism is the most effective.

I understood what she meant, and realised that figuring out what I want in this case isn't a matter of understanding how I feel, but simply of making a decision. She asked me what I truly want, to which I asked for a hug. Admitting that's what I want meant I'd made up my mind: that I want to accept people's warmth, and enjoy their company. Thus, I finally felt comfortable with putting my intentions into clear terms.

>>33687316
That's true. For years I was pointlessly gloomy, even though things had gotten better. Dragging others into that was just a feeble attempt to prolong my pain. But I had desentisised so much that I was starting to lose sight of what's positive and what's negative. And in fact, that's subjective to the point that not even Lilith could tell me what I "should" want.

When I made a wish 8 years ago, I was already deeply in conflict with myself. My teachers said with my talents, I could be anything I wanted. But with a mind broken by loneliness, all I could long for anymore was to be a loving man's housewife. And such a meagre sense of normality seemed so far out of reach, that I was even willing to "sell my soul" for it, offering up everything I valued and believed in.

But Lilith didn't allow that. She granted my wish without taking anything in return, confronting me with an obvious question: "So, what do you want next?" And thus, I began to question myself: "Why did I think I wanted to be such a normal person? In the first place, wasn't I just arrogant for thinking I wasn't?" Perhaps on some level, I began to wonder if the great depths of sorrow and pain I'd overcome were all that truly set me apart. Upon further reflection, it became apparent that I had already begun to think of people's foregone despair as the essence of who I truly am deep down. And who was to say that it can't be? It clearly shaped my development as a person tremendously.

Yet, the shallow wish I'd once made came from the bottom of my heart nonetheless. I finally understood why Mother Lilith hugs me so often: no matter what kind of path one may be on, it's always better with company. And in understanding that, I began to remember what my true will once was, in the absence of boredom and despair:
I want to make people happy.

The difference lies only in what I choose to do. I've decided to embody the ideals I perceive in those I admire, in a way that is both healthy and sustainable.
